nodes.text: Infinite exponential economic growth is essential for the survival and conservation of our economy and civilization
The anti-growth perspective asserts nature (entropy, thermodynamics) imposes fundamental limits on population, production, and consumption
The pro-growth perspective attributes growth potential to knowledge, innovation, and market mechanisms and assumes mental production is exempt from entropy (dualism)
Both dominant perspectives (anti-growth and pro-growth) are limited, subjective, and talk past each other; neither resolves the controversy

The universal process of creation (equilibration producing new disequilibrium and higher levels of organization) generates radical novelties and exponential increases (combinatorics like n squared) that fuel growth
Mental operations and knowledge production are not immune to entropy/resource depletion; creation consumes disequilibrium and faces diminishing returns
Evidence: Bloom et al. show research productivity falls over time (ideas getting harder to find); sustaining constant per-capita growth requires exponentially more researchers
Anti-growth policy recommendations (population limits, reduced production/consumption) are politically painful, socially costly, and lack clear effective mechanisms
Result/Prediction: Failure to maintain exponential growth yields exponential declines in productivity, accelerated resource depletion, and pressures for exponential population increases

Conclusion/Claim: To sustain civilization we must intentionally organize social and economic practice around the process of creationâ€”consciously producing new higher levels of organization to enable infinite exponential growth
Technological innovation and market mechanisms are important but insufficient alone; overreliance on technocratic quick fixes ignores the multilevel creation process

Final conclusion: Infinite exponential growth, driven by continual creation of new organizational levels, can reduce per-capita resource use, limit population pressure, and is the necessary path to conserve human systems and civilization
Method: theoretical analysis, conceptual synthesis, and literature review across thermodynamics, evolutionary systems, economics, creativity studies, and empirical growth research
